alert.note: Alert for Todd (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 10:44PM MDT until further notice by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM MDT/330 AM CDT/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest South Dakota, including the following counties, in south central South Dakota, Todd. In southwest South Dakota, Bennett. * WHEN...Until 230 AM MDT /330 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 PM MDT /1144 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Pass Creek, Beads Creek, Running Enemy Creek, Spring Creek, Cut Meat Creek, Black Pipe Creek, Phister Creek, Peck Creek, Cedar Creek, Lake Creek and Coffee Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuthill, Vetal, Harrington, southeastern Lacreek Wildlife Refuge, southwestern Rosebud Reservation and southeastern Pine Ridge Reservation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
